Heading: Original language of a translated text
Note: Where the text in the original language is NOT part of the current product

Heading: Language of abstracts
Note: Where different from language of text: used mainly for serials

Heading: Original language in a multilingual edition
Note: Where the text in the original language is part of a bilingual or multilingual product

Heading: Translated language in a multilingual edition
Note: Where the text in a translated language is part of a bilingual or multilingual product

Heading: Language of audio track
Note: For example, on an audiobook or video product. Use for the only available audio track, or where there are multiple tracks (eg on a DVD), for an alternate language audio track that is NOT the original. (In the latter case, use code 11 for the original language audio if it is included in the product, or code 10 to identify an original language that is not present in the product)

Heading: Language of original audio track
Note: Where the audio in the original language is NOT part of the current product

Heading: Original language audio track in a multilingual product
Note: Where the audio in the original language is part of a multilingual product with multiple audio tracks

Heading: Language of notes
Note: Use for the language of footnotes, endnotes, annotations or commentary, etc, where it is different from the language of the main text
